heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 24 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting 18 October 2025, is ranked 7th among the longest rainy periods since 23 September 2024.  It has lasted 8 days so far.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the inside temperature (up 1.9°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 234 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.3 mm) and cloud levels (up 401 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 233.5m lower than yesterday, 33.3m lower than the past week, 401.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 794m to 2000m and averaged 963.7m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

Today’s average dew point temperature is 1.1°C higher than yesterday, 2.1°C lower than the past week, 2.1°C lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the dew point temperatures ranged from a minimum of 2.6°C to a maximum of 8.4°C, averaging 6.7°C; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 8.8°C and 8.8°C respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, dry and less humid conditions and little or no wind. Chance of light rain, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and periods of sunshine are expected. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (88%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
